ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a song often of lamentation characterized by usually 12-bar phrases, 3-line stanzas in which the words of the second line usually repeat those of the first, and continual occurrence of blue notes in melody and harmony
{bc}jazz or popular music using harmonic and phrase structures of blues

shortdef: a song often of lamentation characterized by usually 12-bar phrases, 3-line stanzas in which the words of the second line usually repeat those of the first, and continual occurrence of blue notes in melody and harmony
jazz or popular music using harmonic and phrase structures of blues

dt: {bc}a color whose hue is that of the clear sky or that of the portion of the color spectrum lying between green and violet
{bc}a pigment or dye that colors blue
{bc}a Union soldier in the American Civil War

dt.t: praised the writings of her fellow {wi}blues{/wi}

dt: {bc}any of numerous small chiefly blue butterflies (family Lycaenidae)
{bc}one of the three colors {dx_def}see {dxt|color:1|color:1|15}{/dx_def} that quarks have in the theory of {d_link|quantum chromodynamics|quantum chromodynamics}

dt.t: One cannot have a single quark on its own because it would have a color (red, green, or {wi}blue{/wi}). Instead, a red quark has to be joined to a green and a blue quark by a "string" of gluons (red + green + blue = white). Such a triplet constitutes a proton or a neutron.
the job offer came {it}out of the blue{/it}

shortdef: a color whose hue is that of the clear sky or that of the portion of the color spectrum lying between green and violet
a pigment or dye that colors blue

dt: {bc}to make (something) blue in color: such as

dt.t: Last, the generation of the grandmothers, in immaculately {wi}blued{/wi} hair …

dt: {bc}to heat (iron or steel) to about 550 to 600 degrees Fahrenheit so that it acquires a protective bluish coating

dt.t: Between banks shrouded with snow, the river gleamed darkly, like {wi}blued{/wi} steel with gold chips of sunlight dancing on each riffle.
He sliced the air with his fists and {wi}blued the air{/wi} with his mouth.
I have been stealing my father's copy (of Massachusetts Wildlife) for a long time, but last week he found an issue on my desk and {wi}blued the air{/wi} a bit.

shortdef: to make (something) blue in color: such as
to dye, tint, or paint (something) blue
to heat (iron or steel) to about 550 to 600 degrees Fahrenheit so that it acquires a protective bluish coating

ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a feeling of sadness that is experienced by a woman shortly after giving birth, that is typically accompanied by other symptoms (such as mood swings, crying spells, irritability, or insomnia), and that usually lasts less than two weeks {bc}{sx|baby blues|baby blue|3}

dt.t: Up to 70% of women who've given birth experience {wi}postpartum blues{/wi}. The blues can begin several hours after giving birth and last up to two weeks.

shortdef: a feeling of sadness that is experienced by a woman shortly after giving birth, that is typically accompanied by other symptoms (such as mood swings, crying spells, irritability, or insomnia), and that usually lasts less than two weeks : baby blues

dt: {bc}popular music typically including elements of blues and African American folk music and marked by a strong beat and simple chord structure

shortdef: popular music typically including elements of blues and African American folk music and marked by a strong beat and simple chord structure

dt.t: He's been {it}singing the blues{/it} since he lost his job.

shortdef: a feeling of sadness or depression

dt.t: She's a zaftig woman, with long red hair and a pale rose complexion setting off those {wi}baby blues{/wi}.

ins.spl: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a feeling of sadness that is experienced by a woman shortly after giving birth, that is typically accompanied by other symptoms (such as mood swings, crying spells, and insomnia), and that usually lasts less than two weeks {bc}{sx|postpartum blues||}

dt.t: {wi}Baby blues{/wi} isn't an illness or even a proper psychiatric diagnosis, it is simply a way that people have tried to describe unpleasant feelings that occur shortly after having a baby and tend to resolve in a few days.

shortdef: a feeling of sadness that is experienced by a woman shortly after giving birth, that is typically accompanied by other symptoms (such as mood swings, crying spells, and insomnia), and that usually lasts less than two weeks : postpartum blues —usually used with the
